Posts.Content: Feb 2, 2011 08:56AM - edited Feb 2, 2011 08:56AM by InTwoPlaces When I brought up my concern about Lymphedema after my Lumpectomy and Total Axillary dissection with my BS, he told me not to worry about it and now -  when I have learn so much more about the risk I'm upset with his answer. Especially since I'm going to have radiation as well. I told my Onc nurses about my concern and it took me 1/2 hour to get a reference to a specialist where I am going to have 6 sessions about how to prevent Lymphedema. I also got a sleeve (even a night sleeve) to prevent Lymphedema before a flight.
Posts.Title: VISIBLE SIGNS OF LYMPHEDEMA - A PICTORIAL LindaLou53 glennie19

Posts.Content: Dec 23, 2010 02:57PM InTwoPlaces wrote: I'm not a January 2011 Chemo sis (November 2010) but i only want to put my two cents about not using a port and AC. I had the same regimen with AC, 4 weeks. It was never discussed that I shouldn't have the port because my Onc said the Adriamycin is very hard on your veins. I'm so sorry that you have joined the club, but as people already have said; This place has a lot of good information and the women here is wonderful! ps. My hair falled out on my 15th day of my first treatment, my onc has said that it will start to grow again when I start the  TH part, but instead I will lose my eye lashes and eyebrows about the same time I have finished the TH part. Good luck to all of you!

Posts.Content: Feb 7, 2011 05:18PM InTwoPlaces wrote: I'm trying to eat more healthy food and the last weeks I have finished my breakfast or dinner with a half Grape fruit. I also have started to drink Green Tea and today I read that this is REALLY bad for my type of cancer. This is so crazy, I think I need to stop eating completely! It seems like anything I try to make has something in it which will cause the cancer to grow. It takes me hours to try to come up with healthy recipes and then driving around to different Grocery stores to find what I need.
Posts.Title: grapefruit nikola shooshoo23

Posts.Content: Feb 9, 2011 07:04AM - edited Feb 9, 2011 07:06AM by InTwoPlaces Yes, it's like Barbe wrote. My Onc nurses told me yesterday that they don't want BC Chemo patients to drink Green Tea and stay away for everything that is antitoxidants. She also confirmed that Grape fruit should be avoided if you are HER2 and gets Herceptin. Same thing there, it fights the same thing that Herceptin is trying to do.  Remember that this while you are doing Chemo or Herceptin. It doesn't apply after you have completed the treatment.
Posts.Title: grapefruit nikola shooshoo23

Posts.Content: Mar 28, 2011 09:09AM InTwoPlaces wrote: Betterwannabe, I don't want to make you more worried than you already are, but you have to have the lumps checked out! I never felt any lumps in my breast but I happened to find lumps under my armpit, mine turned out to be cancerous. I'm not saying that it has to be the same for you but you really need to see a Dr about it. Hopefully it's nothing! Good luck!

Posts.Content: Feb 17, 2011 03:59PM InTwoPlaces wrote: The risk of puncturing the lung with a port under your collarbone is minimal. "The risk of placement is minimal, although a small amount of bruising is expected. In addition, there is a 1% chance of puncturing the lung during insertion which would require observation in the hospital for several hours. Posts.Title: Pot ~ weed ~ and other cures. :) lisa34lisa radiant

Posts.Content: Jan 31, 2011 10:49AM - edited Jan 31, 2011 10:49AM by InTwoPlaces Lisa,  I haven't read anything about if crime has increased or decreased. The only concern my Onc has and the reason he don't like them is because a lot of "Doctors" give prescriptions to anyone who walks into the door and it gives the "legal MJ" a bad reputation. It's very easy to get illegal MJ here, sometimes it feels like almost anyone use it. They, who defends the use of MJ often asks; "Have you ever seen a person smoking pot get angry and start a fight? I think it's some truth in this and  I believe MJ use is much less dangerous than drinking alcohol. I don't like to smoke it, it just make my legs "disappear" but I have no problem if other people smoke.
Posts.Title: Pot ~ weed ~ and other cures. :) lisa34lisa radiant

Posts.Content: Feb 15, 2011 07:41PM - edited Feb 15, 2011 07:41PM by InTwoPlaces My Onc had me take every test possible! I told him I had been coughing for the last month and he ordered a test of my lungs, he said he was worry about it. Then he saw that my gland had a suspicious form and he wanted me to have a test for that too. Of course I freaked out and couldn't sleep before all the tests came back. It was nothing wrong with my test results, and now I'm glad he decided that I should take them. Hang in there - this is the must difficult time, but it will be better once you know everything about your BC and have made a treatment plan.
Posts.Title: Stage II w/Lymph Node Involvement Warrior517 Moderators

Posts.Content: Jan 31, 2011 04:01AM - edited Jan 31, 2011 04:02AM by InTwoPlaces Donna, I had this treatment, I started with 3 weeks cycles, but after 2 rounds I changed to bi-weekly. I know it's different for all of us, but my SE wasn't that bad,  it got worst for me on round 3 and 4. I had nasuea and was very tired for about a week after the infusion. I got some blemishes on my neck and face after round 3, but they weren't so bad either. I had dry mouth and used Biotene mouthwash and I drank a lot of water. Overall, my SE was much less than I had expected, even though I had some days when I didn't do much other than laying in the sofa and watch movies. I wish you good luck!

Posts.Content: May 3, 2011 10:03PM InTwoPlaces wrote: Hi all! - I recognize some of you from the November chemo thread I had lumpectomy with total axillary dissection, followed by AC and then T(H) I wasn't able to have # 12 of the Taxol, because of all the blisters I got. I will have Herceptin for the rest of the year. I'm a Sun-lover too and I live in California so I'm not looking forward to the radiation. I have a port, but I asked my MO and my MO nurse if I could remove the port and use my arm for the Herceptin and they said there will be no problem. I will call my BS first thing tomorrow morning to make an appointment to have it removed. I was told no deodorant, and to use either Aloe or Calendula 3 times a day. What worries me the most is the high risk of LE.
